folder: Washington Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
Washington Street, north from W. Houston Street, showing mainly the west side of this thoroughfare. In the foreground are a row of stables extending to Clarkson Street. In 1930 these buildings will be razed for the St. Johns Park Freight Terminal; this site being the proposed northern portion of same.
Buildings north of Clarkson Street will be demolished at same time and the elevated roadbed of the New York Central Railroad erected there. The street car tracks shown will be removed by the W.P.a. in l937.
View No. 3 shows buildings at the N.W. corner of Washington
(right) and W. Houston (left) Streets.
View 1: May 12, 1927
View 2: July 23, 1930
View 3: Oct. 21, 1927
P. L. Sperr

folder: Houston Street (West & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Houston Street, western section (formerly Hammersley Street), north side, from Washington to West Streets, inclusive. A view of the block which will be permanently closed when the new St. John's
Park Freight Terminal is built in 1933-34.
October 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Washington Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Washington Street, from West Houston (formerly Hammersley) Street to King Street, east side, seen from cleared west side.  In the background the Standard Statistics Building, on the west side of Hudson Street from King to Charlton Streets, is shown under construction.
September 30, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a little over five weeks later.
November, 8, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

folder: Washington Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
Washington Street, west side, from West Houston (formerly Hammersley)
Street to Clarkson Street, inclusive.
September 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Washington Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Washington Street, west side, from West Houston (formerly
Hammersley) Street to Leroy Street, inclusive.
September 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, to Leroy Street and north. The northern end of the new St. John's Park Freight Terminal will be at Clarkson Street, but the buildings on the west side of Washington Street north from that point are being razed for the building of
the railroad's elevated roadbed.
June 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Houston Street (West & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Houston Street, western section (formerly Hammersley Street), south side, from Washington to Greenwich Streets, and east; the view is rather blocked by the elevated station.
July 16, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the Houston Street "L" Station at 9th Avenue.
May 20th,I940
P.L.Sperr
